decks.notes: The main goal of this deck is to control the game by utilizing Fires of Invention to cast multiple spells for free each turn. The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with cards like Growth Spiral and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath, while also controlling the board with cards like Shatter the Sky and Agent of Treachery. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for extra value by blinking permanents for additional triggers. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to dominate the battlefield with powerful spells and overwhelming resources.

The deck focuses on utilizing Fires of Invention to cast powerful spells for free, while controlling the board with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Deafening Clarion. The goal is to establish board presence with creatures like Cavalier of Flame and Sphinx of Foresight, while also having removal options like Bonecrusher Giant and Elspeth Conquers Death. The companion, Keruga, the Macrosage, provides card advantage and fits well with the deck's control style. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents through efficient control and powerful creatures.

The deck is focused on using Fires of Invention to cast spells for free, while controlling the board with Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset of the Ancient Way. The key strategy is to ramp up quickly with mana sources like Savai Triome and Fabled Passage, and then overwhelming the opponent with powerful creatures like Sphinx of Foresight, Cavalier of Flame, and Bonecrusher Giant. Deafening Clarion provides board wipe potential, while Shark Typhoon generates additional threats. The inclusion of Keruga, the Macrosage as a companion allows for drawing additional cards while maintaining a high mana curve.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through card advantage and powerful spells, while utilizing Wilderness Reclamation to generate mana and enable multiple spell casts in a turn. The deck focuses on countering and removing threats using cards like Mystical Dispute, Scorching Dragonfire, and Shark Typhoon, while also drawing cards and ramping with Growth Spiral and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. The goal is to outvalue and outlast the opponent, eventually finishing them off with powerful spells like Expansion / Explosion or a large Shark Typhoon token.

The deck aims to control the game by utilizing powerful permanents and removal spells to disrupt the opponent's strategy. It focuses on ramping up mana with cards like Growth Spiral and Nissa, Who Shakes the World, while also having access to powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Tamiyo, Collector of Tales for card advantage and control. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional value by blinking permanents like Omen of the Sea and Elspeth Conquers Death. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent and grind out a win through card advantage and powerful threats.

This deck focuses on controlling the board and disrupting the opponent's strategy using a combination of removal spells, hand disruption, and powerful planeswalkers. The key mechanic of this deck is Fires of Invention, allowing the player to cast spells for free once it's in play. The deck also utilizes the companion Yorion, Sky Nomad for additional value and card advantage. By utilizing a combination of control elements and powerful cards, this deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent in a longer game.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing Fires of Invention to cast spells for free. The deck includes a variety of powerful creatures and planeswalkers to maintain board presence and disrupt the opponent's strategy. By playing efficient and impactful spells while limiting the opponent's actions with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and secure victory through card advantage and strategic play.

The key concept of this Temur Control deck is to utilize Wilderness Reclamation to generate mana and control the board with spells like Shark Typhoon, Mystical Dispute, and Expansion / Explosion. The deck aims to ramp up quickly with Growth Spiral and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath while using countermagic like Negate and Essence Scatter to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The inclusion of Fabled Passage and Castle Vantress provides additional utility and card selection. Overall, the deck focuses on maintaining control of the game through a combination of mana advantage and powerful spells.

The deck focuses on controlling the board through various counterspells and removal spells, while also ramping up mana and gaining life with cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Hydroid Krasis. It aims to stabilize the board with cards like Shatter the Sky and Elspeth Conquers Death, before closing out the game with powerful threats like Dream Trawler and Nissa, Who Shakes the World. The deck also utilizes planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Tamiyo, Collector of Tales to generate card advantage and control the game.

The main focus of this Boros Aggro deck is to utilize cycling cards to quickly fill up the graveyard and then use Zenith Flare to deal damage to the opponent based on the number of cards in the graveyard. By constantly cycling cards and creating tokens with cards like Valiant Rescuer, the deck aims to quickly build up a large graveyard and win the game with a powerful Zenith Flare. Additionally, the deck includes removal spells like Go for Blood and disruptive cards like Memory Leak to control the game and push for a fast victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures with high power and haste to quickly overrun the opponent. By applying early pressure and maintaining a fast tempo, it aims to close out the game before the opponent can establish their own board presence. Cards like Embercleave and Gruul Spellbreaker provide additional ways to push damage through and secure victory. The inclusion of a few removal spells and planeswalkers gives the deck some versatility and additional ways to close out games. Overall, the strategy revolves around fast, powerful creatures and efficient combat tricks to dominate the opponent.

This deck focuses on cycling small creatures to trigger effects like Zenith Flare and Valiant Rescuer to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The key strategy is to cycle through cards efficiently while still maintaining a board presence to overwhelm the opponent with damage. Lurrus of the Dream-Den is used as a companion to provide additional value by recurring key cards from the graveyard. Overall, the deck aims to be fast, aggressive, and able to adapt to different situations by utilizing its cycling abilities effectively.

The key strategy of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a consistent flow of low-cost aggressive creatures and use sacrifice effects to generate value and disrupt their game plan. By utilizing cards like Cauldron Familiar, Witch's Oven, and Priest of Forgotten Gods, the deck aims to maintain board presence and drain the opponent's resources. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for additional recursion of key creatures, making it difficult for the opponent to stabilize. Castle Locthwain helps to draw additional cards to keep the pressure up.

The deck focuses on using sacrifice synergy and recursion to maintain a steady stream of pressure on the opponent. With creatures like Cauldron Familiar and Serrated Scorpion providing repeatable sacrifice triggers, along with cards like Priest of Forgotten Gods and Witch's Oven, the deck aims to control the board while dealing consistent damage. The inclusion of cards like Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger and Dreadhorde Butcher adds additional pressure and recursive threats to overwhelm the opponent. The deck also utilizes Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion for extra consistency and value.

The deck focuses on utilizing cheap, aggressive creatures with sacrifice synergies to maintain board presence and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Lurrus of the Dream-Den acts as a companion to provide additional value by recurring low-cost permanents from the graveyard. With cards like Cauldron Familiar, Dreadhorde Butcher, and Priest of Forgotten Gods, the deck aims to apply constant pressure on the opponent and create advantageous board states. The deck also includes interactive cards like Claim the Firstborn to take control of key threats from the opponent.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm and defeat the opponent through aggressive and efficient creature plays. By utilizing cards like Torbran, Thane of Red Fell and Embercleave, the deck aims to deal significant damage in a short amount of time. The inclusion of cards like Fervent Champion and Bonecrusher Giant provide additional damage sources, while cards like Light Up the Stage help maintain card advantage. With a heavy emphasis on red creatures and burn spells, this deck aims to win the game swiftly through relentless aggression.
